page.title: 18Employment
page.content: Last year, a young man, Robert Gilston, aged 21, decided to strike out on his own, to avoid being unemployed, despite the fact that there is already a fencer and dyker in the area. Robert learned his trade locally, and uses the raw materials on the site of his work, ie broken down walls. Because of the huge mileage of stone walls which continually fall down with age, Robert says there will always be plenty of work. From the centre of the village the firm of Neil and McWhirter run a heavy haulage business. There are three workers, who are kept busy working on new road developments, and on many other sites needing heavy plants.
